0.11: Every day they rushed to the door of the garden to see her.
0.10: Even though both were overcome with passion, the men did not reveal their love to each other because they were embarrassed.
0.13: After they went and after the men separated from one another, each one turned back and returned to the garden and found themselves together.
0.12: The men said to each other, "let us return to our houses because it is near time for lunch."
0.1: And he took for himself a woman, Susanna the daughter of Hilkiah; and she was beautiful and feared God
0.0: There was a man in the city of Babylon, and his name was Jehoiakim.
0.3: And Jehoiakim was very rich and he had a desirable garden by his house; and everyone gathered unto him because he was the most respected of the men of the city.
0.2: because her parents were righteous and directed her in the paths of the Torah of Moses.
0.5: They were among the men about whom the LORD said, "from Babylon there went out wickedness, and from her elders, the judges of the nation."
0.4: In that year, two elders of the city became judges of the nation.
0.7: In the afternoon[s], when every person had gone his way, Susanna would go to swim in her husband's garden.
0.6: They came everyday to Jehoiakim's house, and if a person had a concern, he would come to them.
0.9: Their hearts were turned and instead of turning their eyes to heaven, they turned their eyes toward her; and they did not remember the Torah of the LORD or his judgments.
0.8: The elders saw the woman walking every day in the garden and they lusted.
